beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Technical enough to thin the pack. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. 1,500m over 78km delivers consistent climbing without being gratuitously brutal. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Circuits of Llyn Alwen and Llyn Brenig through Clocaenog Forest deliver North Wales wilderness experience. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. GPX files arrive 2-4 days before with packet pickup opening at 7:45am for an 8:00am start creates morning stress. Length. 2 out of 5. Won't destroy your week. Jon in Sweden completed the 104km route in 3hrs 38min at elite pace, averaging 336w with 370w normalized power. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Jon in Sweden experienced "intermittent showers and 30kph wind" with temperatures of "16-17c" in April 2024, calling it "miserable weather really. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Experience. 2 out of 5. A nice day on the bike. Nothing more. Community. 2 out of 5. Riders acknowledge each other. Barely. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Reasonable costs. Plan a modest budget. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Small field. You might podium by showing up.
